content: three finger gloves a knitting pattern by jellyplus  simple gloves that allow more finger movement than casual mittens and more warmth and cosiness than 5-finger gloves perfect for everyday adventures or more intense cold weather activities where you need some grip and precision pattern pictures notes © jellyplus 2020 || please do not use or sell items knit from this pattern for commercial purposes 1 sizing the pattern is written for a size l hand length measured from tip of the middle finger down to the base of palm approx 20-22 cm or 8-9 inches gauge 21 stitches and 23 row in 4 inches or 10 cm in stockinette materials yarn approx 270 m of dk to light worsted weight yarn or sport and fingering weight yarn held together as in sample sample shown in  drops alpaca 100% alpaca 167 meters/183 yards per 50 grams colour 0517 mix  holst supersoft 50% merino wool and 50% shetland wool 287 meters/314 yards per 50 grams colour 005 oxford abbreviations needles  co - cast on 3 25 mm us 3 needles or needle size required  sts - stitches to obtain pattern gauge in double-pointed nee-  k - knit stitch dles or long circulars depending on preferred  p - purl stitch method of working in the round  k2tog - knit 2 stitches together 1 stitch recommended needle size is smaller than the decrease usual needle size you would use for this weight of yarn to get more compact and durable fabric  ssk - slip 2 stitches knitwise one at a time & knit together through the back loop 1 stitch other decrease  m1r - make one right lift loop between tapestry needle stitches from the back work into front of stitch markers loop 1 stitch increase waste yarn  m1l - make one left lift loop between stitches from the front work into back of notes loop 1 stitch increase  k1fb - knit one front and back 1 stitch the glove is worked from the cuff towards the increase top the instructions for right and left glove are the same  pm - place marker  slm - slip marker pattern pictures notes © jellyplus 2020 || please do not use or sell items knit from this pattern for commercial purposes 2 instructions co 40 sts join in the round mark the beginning of the round with a marker cuff thumb increases k1 p1 for 25 row next row k13 k1fb pm k15 pm k1fb k14 = 46 sts start body of glove next row k all next row k to 1 st before marker k1fb slm k to next row k1 m1r knit 18 sts m1l k1 repeat marker slm k1fb knit to end = 48 sts once you should have 44 sts at the end of the next row k all round next row repeat last 2 row four times you next row k all for 5 row should have 56
